keyMoments.title: Returns to Marineford
keyMoments.description: Luffy returns to Marineford with Rayleigh and Jinbe aboard a stolen Marine ship, making a bold statement by returning to the site of his greatest defeat and Ace's death.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's emotional growth and resilience. Instead of avoiding the traumatic location, he confronts it to properly honor the fallen and send a message to his crew.

keyMoments.title: Rings the Ox Bell 16 Times
keyMoments.description: Luffy enters the Marineford plaza and rings the sacred Ox Bell sixteen times, a symbolic act representing the end of one era and the beginning of another.
keyMoments.significance: This iconic moment serves as both a public declaration and a coded message to his crew. It shows Luffy's willingness to make bold statements while also participating in Rayleigh's strategic plan.

keyMoments.title: Displays 3D2Y Tattoo Message
keyMoments.description: Luffy is photographed with a temporary tattoo reading '3D2Y' with the '3D' crossed out, sending a coded message to his crew to meet in 2 years instead of 3 days.
keyMoments.significance: A clever communication that only his crew would understand, demonstrating the deep bond between the Straw Hats and setting up the two-year timeskip training period.

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Accompanies Luffy to Marineford
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh escorts Luffy to Marineford as part of his carefully orchestrated plan to send a message to the Straw Hat crew while allowing Luffy to pay respects to the fallen.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Rayleigh's role as mentor and strategist. His presence signals to the world that Luffy may be groomed as Roger's successor.

keyMoments.title: Returns to Marineford with Luffy
keyMoments.description: Jinbe accompanies Luffy and Rayleigh to Marineford, providing support and protection during this symbolic journey.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jinbe's continued commitment to helping Luffy, solidifying their friendship and foreshadowing his eventual joining of the Straw Hat crew.

keyMoments.title: Retires as Fleet Admiral and Nominates Aokiji
keyMoments.description: Sengoku officially steps down as Fleet Admiral of the Marines and nominates Admiral Aokiji as his successor.
keyMoments.significance: Marks a major transition in Marine leadership following the Marineford War. His choice of Aokiji over Akainu reveals his preference for moderate justice.

reveals.information: Retires from position of Fleet Admiral

keyMoments.title: Nominated as Fleet Admiral
keyMoments.description: Admiral Aokiji is nominated by Sengoku to become the next Fleet Admiral of the Marines.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the future conflict over Marine leadership and Aokiji's eventual departure from the Marines after losing to Akainu.

reveals.information: Nominated to become Fleet Admiral by Sengoku

keyMoments.title: Observation Haki Awakening Revealed
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Koby awakened Observation Haki (Kenbunshoku Haki) during the traumatic events of the Marineford War.
keyMoments.significance: Marks a major milestone in Koby's development as a Marine and demonstrates his exceptional potential. Shows that extreme battlefield stress can trigger Haki awakening.

abilities.description: The ability to sense the presence, emotions, and intentions of others. Koby awakened this during the Marineford War.

reveals.information: Awakened Observation Haki during the Marineford War

keyMoments.title: Requests Transfer to G-5
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Smoker requests a transfer to the G-5 Marine base in the New World, seeking to continue his pursuit of pirates in the most dangerous waters.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Smoker's future role in the New World and his presence at Punk Hazard where he will encounter the Straw Hats again.

keyMoments.title: Kid Pirates in the New World
keyMoments.description: Eustass Kid and his crew are shown in the New World, reading about Luffy's return to Marineford and discussing the harsh realities of these waters.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Kid's presence in the New World and his competitive relationship with Luffy. His comment about Paradise versus the New World emphasizes the danger escalation.
keyMoments.quote: The first half of the Grand Line was paradise compared to the New World.

keyMoments.title: Interprets Luffy's Bell Message
keyMoments.description: Killer interprets Luffy's ringing of the Ox Bell 16 times as a declaration of the end of one era and the beginning of another.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how the pirate world interprets Luffy's actions as a bold declaration, missing the hidden message meant only for the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: The end of one era and the beginning of another!

keyMoments.title: Encounters Sea Monster in New World
keyMoments.description: Capone Bege's ship is suddenly lifted into the air by a massive sea creature while sailing through the New World, despite his confident dismissal of Luffy's actions.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the unpredictable dangers of the New World where even confident pirates can be caught off guard.
keyMoments.quote: Whoever makes the final move will ultimately be the victor.

keyMoments.title: Confronts Brownbeard at Foodvalten
keyMoments.description: Basil Hawkins uses his tarot cards to predict Brownbeard's death and activates his Devil Fruit power to eliminate the territorial pirate.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hawkins' ruthless nature and his Devil Fruit abilities. Shows the violent territorial conflicts occurring in the New World.
keyMoments.quote: I don't like jokes. I can see the shadow of death over you.

keyMoments.title: Attempts to Land on Raijin Island
keyMoments.description: Urouge and his crew struggle to land on Raijin Island, which is constantly struck by lightning. A mysterious old woman offers to sell them umbrellas.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases another extreme environmental hazard in the New World and hints at inhabitants who have adapted to these conditions.

keyMoments.title: First Appearance at Foodvalten
keyMoments.description: Brownbeard appears on Foodvalten island, claiming it as his territory and demanding that Basil Hawkins leave. He is a large pirate captain with a brown beard.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a character who will later become relevant in the Punk Hazard arc. Establishes the territorial conflicts in the New World.

reveals.information: A pirate captain who claims Foodvalten as his territory

keyMoments.title: Conducts Marine Intelligence Briefing
keyMoments.description: Lieutenant Commander Brannew briefs a room of Marine vice-admirals about the aftermath of the Marineford War and Luffy's survival.
keyMoments.significance: Provides exposition about the global state of affairs post-Marineford and the Marine perspective on recent events.
